intro: Clidemia leptopus, commonly known as the silverleaf or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage that gives it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Clidemia leptopus is also known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense thickets, making it an invasive species in some areas.
